li.p: The point (a, b) lies on the graph of the function f if and only if f (a) = b.
Each point on the graph of the function f has coordinates (x, f (x)) for some value of x.
The vertical line test tells us whether a graph represents a function.
We can use a graph to solve equations and inequalities in one variable.
How can you find the value of f (3) from a graph of f?
If f (8) = 2, what point lies on the graph of f?
Explain how to construct the graph of a function from its equation.
Explain how to use the vertical line test.
How can you solve the equation x + \sqrt{x} = 56 using the graph of y = x + \sqrt{x}?
